title: UK Brexit planning minister Gove delighted by Johnson, Varadkar talks
text:
LONDON, Oct 10 (Reuters) - Michael Gove, the British minister in charge of the government's preparations for Brexit, said talks between Prime Minister Boris Johnson and his Irish counterpart on Thursday had been constructive and he was delighted they had reported progress.

"The conversations between the prime minister and Leo Varadkar, they were cordial, they were constructive, they were open and they say there's going to be progress, so I'm delighted," he told BBC TV. (Reporting by Michael Holden; editing by Stephen Addison)
